Ticket Central’s ‘Weekly Specials’ go on sale on a specific day for a specific performance date and time, so look for these details in each listing.        Valid NYUCard or Alumni ID is required for all purchases.  Only NYUCardholders with full university privileges (dark purple ID color) and alumni with valid Alumni ID (purple and white card with current date) may purchase tickets to theatre, performing arts, sports and other special events on the first day of sale. Only NYUCard holders with full university privileges (dark purple ID color) and Alumni with valid Alumni ID may purchase tickets to theatre, performing arts, sports and other special events, or claim free tickets to shows or movies on the first day of sale or distribution.   Please note that certain offers and deals are only available with an active NYU Home account. NYU Broadway Percussion Seminar - Summer Programs - NYU Steinhardt                                                      Skip to content         NYU Steinhardt School of Culture, Education, and Human    Graduate     Doctoral     Prospective Student Auditions           People        Faculty     Students     Alumni     Staff           Ensembles        Overview     Audition Guidelines     Audition Faculty Research Interests     Faculty Collaborations           Events        Facilities        Facilities     Music Technology Facilities           FAQ                 Summer Programs                 Programs      Instrumental Performance          Summer Brass Workshop      Broadway Percussion Seminar      Jazz Improv Workshop      Karen Tuttle Coordination Conference      Piano Intensive      SummerStrings@NYU      Summer Institute for Woodwind Studies           Vocal Performance          Classical Voice Intensive      Summer Study in Music Theatre           Scoring & Songwriting          ASCAP Film Scoring Workshop      NYU/BMI Music in Advertising Workshop      Summer Songwriters Workshop      Music and the Moving Image           Music Business          What Makes a Star?      Music Business Innovation Lab           Music Technology          Summer Electronic Music Institute      Summer Institute of Music Production Technology      Girls Electronic Music Seminar           Music Education          IMPACT Workshop      IMPACT Conference      Kodály Summer Institute      Kodály Summer Institute in Hungary     Performamatics           Dance Education          Teaching Contemporary Limón      Summer Dance Intensive           Educational Theatre          Looking for Shakespeare      New Plays for Young Audiences           Music Therapy          Nordoff-Robbins Music Therapy           Music Theory          Music Theory Pedagogy Workshop              Application Information        How to Apply     Audition Requirements     Housing & Meal Plans     Finances     International Students     Current NYU Students     Information for Summer Students     Information for Parents        Contact Us                     NYU Broadway Percussion Seminar                        Program Description & Faculty | Costs | Apply & Audition | For More Information    Overview    Intended For: All Levels    See the Broadway Percussion Seminar at a glance:       Program Dates: June 14 - June 18, 2015    Priority Application Deadline: April 13, 2015    Final Application Deadline: May 1, 2015    Required Student Orientation: June 14, 2015    Housing Dates: June 14 - June 20, 2015    Tuition: $850    Please note that performance-based and need-based scholarships are not offered in conjunction with this program    Percussion Studies       Program Description & Faculty    Hosted by the NYU Steinhardt Percussion Studies Program, with special guest percussionists, contractors, and conductors from the world of Broadway. Broadway shows and sessions will be presented on drum set, percussion, mallet percussion, timpani, and Latin percussion, by the percussionists who developed the books! For high school, college and professional percussionists, the NYU Broadway Percussion Seminar/Summit is a five-day intensive study of the skills, experience, and know-how into the world of Broadway percussion. Panel discussions will be held with leading percussionists, conductors and contractors who are actively pursuing musical careers on Broadway. In addition, students will attend two Broadway shows, offering the opportunity for each participant to experience a live broadway pit, during an actual broadway show! Dinner will be served after the matinee performance, with the show's percussionists in attendance. Past Broadway Seminar presenters have included: John Clancy and Jon Epcar (Spiderman), Charlie Descarfino (Porgy and Bess), Javier Diaz (Guys and Dolls and Tarzan), Wilson Torres (In the Heights), Dan Haskins and David Ratajczak (Mary Poppins), Pablo Rieppi (West Side Story), Erik Charlston (How to Succeed in Business), James Saporito (NYC Ballet and Tony Awards), Valerie Naranjo and Tommy Igoe (The Lion King), Kory Grossman (Broadway's Super Sub), Ben Herman (Film Recording), and many more.       For a complete list of current NYU Percussion faculty, please click here .    Itinerary & Seminars    Throughout the week, you will have the opportunity to meet and work with several percussionists and contractors who are actively pursuing careers on Broadway. A typical session will cover a variety of topics, including: an overview of the show and book, setup issues, use of technology and video monitors, artist background, subbing on Broadway, pay-scale for Broadway musicians, and many others. Artists will perform excerpts from their book, and hands-on participants will be sent a portion of a show to prepare and perform for the percussionists in a masterclass setting. Participants are typically sent 4 - 6 pieces from one show to prepare. A detailed itinerary of last year's NYUBPS is copied below for reference:        2013 NYU Broadway Percussion Seminar Itinerary*        Sunday :       9:00am : Residence hall check in begins    7:00pm : Welcome Session with Jonathan Haas and Sean Statser        Monday :       10:00am - 1:00pm : Charlie Descarfino (Far From Heaven)    1:00pm – 1:45pm : Lunch Break    1:45pm - 4:45pm : Ben Herman (Film recording session in Dolan Studios) / Javier Diaz (Hands-on session)    4:45pm – 7:00pm : Dinner Break    7:00pm - 10:00pm : Ray Marchica (Mamma Mia)        Tuesday :       10:00am - 1:00pm : Michael Sgouros (Hollow – Player’s Theatre, 115 Macdougal Street)    1:00pm – 2:00pm : Lunch Break    2:00pm – 5:00pm : James Saporito (The Tony Awards)    5:00pm – 7:00pm : Dinner Break    7:00pm - 10:00pm : Kory Grossman (Pirates of Penzance)        Wednesday :       10:30am - 11:30am : NYU Admissions Session    11:30am – 12:15pm : Lunch Break    12:15pm : Leave for Broadway Shows and Pits    2:00pm – 5:00pm : Matinee Performance    5:00pm – 7:00pm : Dinner at Musician’s Union - Local 802    7:00pm – 10:00pm : Evening Performance        Thursday :       11:00am - 2:00pm : John Clancy and Jon Epcar (Spiderman – Room 779)    2:00pm – 3:00pm : Lunch Break    3:00pm - 6:00pm : Roundtable Discussion with John Miller (Broadway Contractor) and artists from throughout the week    6:00pm – 7:00pm : Dinner in Percussion Penthouse       *Please note : The above schedule is a sample and not the confirmed itenerary for the 2014 NYU Broadway Percussion Seminar.       Costs    Below are all costs associated with the Broadway Percussion Seminar:       2015 Tuition: $850    Optional Programming Fee: $40    Application Fee: $50; nonrefundable and paid at the end of the 2015 Summer Application    Housing & Meal Plan (optional): $381 shared room with 10 meals and 30 Dining Dollars per week - see the Housing & Meal Plan page for more information       Please note that there are additional fees for all International Students . For information about financial aid and scholarships, see the Finances page.    Apply & Audition                Acceptance is on a rolling admissions basis and limited to 25 participants. We encourage you to apply early to guarantee your spot.       The final application deadline is May 1 , 2015. A complete application includes:          Complete a 2015 Summer Application    For hands-on participants only: submit all Required Materials (see Broadway Percussion Seminar)             There is NO AUDITION required to participate in the NYU Broadway Percussion Seminar.    If you are planning on attending the Seminar as a hands-on participant , then you are required to submit a placement recording. Hands-on participants will be sent a portion of a Broadway show to prepare for one of the Seminar sessions with the percussionists who developed the books. Show assignments will be made based on your placement recording, experience level, previously performed shows and repertoire, and your given interest in a specific area of Broadway percussion (drum set, Latin percussion, or general percussion).    Submit a recording (either audio or video), that demonstrates your playing in any, or all, of the areas mentioned above. This can include: orchestral excerpts, solo performances, ensemble performances, a compilation of drum set styles, or a compilation of hand drum styles.    Acceptance to the NYU Broadway Percussion Seminar is on a rolling admissions basis. As soon as your application is completed, you will receive your acceptance notification. Once the seminar is filled to capacity, it will be closed for further applications.
